etymology.description: 首(首) (shǒu, "head") + 卩(卩) (jié, "kneeling person") = head of a kneeling person -> head -> later adopted for "page"
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicting the head of a kneeling person, 頁(頁) (yè, "head") transitioned from describing a physical head to denote a "page" or "sheet," connecting the idea of a main part of a document or book.
etymology.simplification: 页(頁): The character was simplified from 頁 to 页 by retaining essential strokes, emphasizing cursive efficiency.

examples.chinese: 我翻开书(我翻開書)，读到第一页(讀到第一頁)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ fān kāi shū, dú dào dì yī yè.
examples.english: I opened the book and read the first page.

examples.chinese: 他在古籍中找到了很多页(他在古籍中找到了很多頁)，记录着历史秘密(記錄著歷史秘密)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài gǔjí zhōng zhǎo dào le hěn duō yè, jìlù zhe lìshǐ mìmì.
examples.english: He found many pages in the ancient texts that record historical secrets.
